alert.note: Alert for Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 7:36AM CDT until March 26 at 4:40PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Christian, Greene, Lawrence, Stone, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen, leading to flooding of low lying areas. - This includes the following low water crossings... Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road, Wilson`s Creek at Old Limey Road, Elk Creek at Highway Z and James River at Bell Ford Road. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 64 and 106. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
